bibl.title: Letter from Robert F. Nelson to Jefferson Randolph Kean, July 20, 1927

div1.p: Nelson sends a photograph of Walter Reed's birthplace and text on its dedication as a national shrine.

div1.head: Letter from Robert F. Nelson to Jefferson Randolph Kean, July 20, 1927
div1.opener:
VIRGINIA
FIRST IN THE HEART OF THE NATION
VIRGINIA STATE CHAMBER OF COMMERCE
GRACE-AMERICAN BUILDING, RICHMOND
VICE-PRESIDENT
J. SCOTT PARRISH
PRESIDENT
JUNIUS P. FISHBURN
TREASURER
JULIEN H. HILL
GENERAL SECRETARY
LAWSON M. COOKE
MANAGING DIRECTOR
LEROY NODGES
DIRECTOR OF PUBLICITY
ROBERT F. NELSON
ORGANIZATION SECRETARY
HENRY L. CARAVATI
BOARD OF DIRECTORS
C. G. ANDERSEN, HOT SPRINGS
R. H. ANGELL, ROENGER
A. B. CARRINGTON, DANVILLE
RICHARD CRANE, WESTOVER
LOUIS T. DOGIE, NORFOLK
JUNIUS P. FISHBURN, ROANOKE
H. H. HARRIS, LYNCHBURG
JULIEN H. HILL, RICHMOND
LEE LONG, DANTE
I. J. MARCUEF, RICHMOND
L. U. NOLAND, NEWPORT NEWS
H. L. OPIE, STAUNTON
J. SCOTT PARRISH, RICHMOND
C. PAGE WALLER, JR., ALEXANDRIA
SAMUEL G. WALLER, FRONT ROYAL
G. G. WRIGHT, PETERSBURG
SAMUEL W. ZIMMER, PETERSBURG
July 20, 1927.
Military Surgeon,
Army Medical Museum,
Washington, D. C.
Assoc'n Military Surgeons, U.S.
JUL 21 1927
Secretary-Treasurer's Office.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
Under separate cover the Virginia State
Chamber of Commerce is forwarding you a print of the
birthplace of Dr. Walter Reed. A story on its dedica-
tion as a national shrine is also sent your publication and we hope
that if you use it you will be kind enough to send us
a copy. No other cost is attached to the picture.
Should it not prove available for your use I would ap-
preciate your returning same to these offices.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, R. F. Nelson
Director of Publicity, N:A
